DOC.brief_summary: The rise high fructose corn syrup ( HFCS ) consumption past 40 year since introduction popular sweetener United States lead much concern regard contribution rise obesity ( 1 ) , diabetes ( 2 ) relate cardiometabolic disorder ( 3 ) .Unlike sucrose contains equal proportion fructose glucose bound Î±-glycosidic bond , HFCS contain 42-55 % fructose glucose free ( unbound ) form ( 4 ) . Despite difference composition , sugar possess identical energy contribution gram gram basis ( 4 ) . However , high ratio fructose glucose HFCS lead hypothesis HFCS may uniquely contribute cardiometabolic risk , sucrose , propose difference fructose metabolism , endocrine hedonic property ( 5 ) . We conduct series systematic review meta-analyses assess role HFCS versus sucrose energy match ( isocaloric ) condition cardiometabolic risk .
DOC.brief_title: Meta-analyses Effect Sucrose Versus High Fructose Corn Syrup Cardiometabolic Risk
DOC.detailed_description: Need propose research : High quality systematic review meta-analyses control trial represent high level evidence support dietary guideline public health policy development . As HFCS gain increase popularity popular sweetener past ~50 year , replace sucrose diet , urgent need systematic review meta-analyses compare sucrose versus HFCS development cardiometaboilc disease . Objective : The investigator conduct series systematic review meta-analyses distinguish effect isocaloric exchange sucrose versus HFCS cardiometabolic risk control trial . Design : Each systematic review meta-analysis conduct accord Cochrane Handbook Systematic Reviews Interventions report accord Preferred Reporting Items Systematic Reviews Meta-Analyses ( PRISMA ) . Data source : MEDLINE , EMBASE , The Cochrane Central Register Controlled Trials ( Clinical Trials ; CENTRAL ) search use appropriate search term supplement hand search reference include study . Study selection : The investigator include randomize non-randomized controlled trial > = 7-days duration ass effect sucrose versus HFCS isocaloric condition measure cardiometabolic risk . Direct comparison sucrose versus HFCS indirect comparison sucrose HFCS versus carbohydrates energy-matched condition conduct . Data extraction : Two investigator independently extract relevant data ass risk bias use Cochrane Risk Bias Tool . All disagreement resolve consensus . Standard computation imputation use derive miss variance data . Outcomes : Seven set outcome assess : ( 1 ) body weight marker adipsoity ( 2 ) glycemic control , ( 3 ) blood pressure , ( 4 ) blood lipid , ( 5 ) uric acid , ( 6 ) non-alcoholic fatty liver disease ( NAFLD ) ectopic fat , ( 7 ) inflammation Data synthesis : Mean difference pool use generic inverse variance method data available 2 trial . Random-effects model use even absence statistically significant between-study heterogeneity , yield conservative summary effect estimate presence residual heterogeneity . Fixed-effects model use < 5 included study . Paired analyse apply crossover trial . Heterogeneity assess Cochran Q statistic quantify I2 statistic . To explore source heterogeneity , investigator conduct sensitivity analysis , study systematically remove . If > =10 study per endpoint , investigator also explore source heterogeneity priori subgroup analysis age ( child [ = < 18 year age ] , adult ) , health status ( metabolic syndrome criterion , diabetes , overweight/ obese , healthy ) , comparator type , fructose- containing sugar form ( sucrose , HFCS , honey , fructose ) , dose ( = < 10 % energy , > 10 % energy ) , baseline measurement , randomization , study design ( parallel , crossover ) , energy balance ( positive , neutral , negative ) , follow-up ( = < 8-weeks , > 8-weeks ) , risk bias . Meta-regression analysis assess significance categorical continuous subgroup analysis . When > =10 study available , publication bias investigate inspection funnel plot formal test use Egger 's Begg 's test . If publication bias suspect , investigator attempt adjust funnel plot asymmetry impute miss study data use Duval Tweedie trim fill method . Evidence Assessment : The strength evidence outcome assess use Grading Recommendations Assessment , Development Evaluation ( GRADE ) . Knowledge translation plan : The result disseminate interactive presentation local , national , international scientific meeting publication high impact factor journal . Target audience include public health scientific community interest nutrition , diabetes , obesity , cardiovascular disease . Feedback incorporate use improve public health message key area future research define . Applicant/Co-applicant Decision Makers network among opinion leader increase awareness participate directly committee member development future guideline . Significance : The propose project aid knowledge translation relate role sucrose versus HFCS development cardiometabolic disease , strengthen evidence-base guideline improve health outcome educate healthcare provider patient , stimulate industry innovation , guide future research design .
DOC.criteria: Trials human Oral fructosecontaining sugar intervention Presence adequate comparator isocaloric substitution Diet duration > =7 day Viable outcome data Nonhuman trial Observational study IV parenteral fructosecontaining sugar Lack suitable comparator ( i.e . comparator arm include sucrose HFCS isocaloric substitution ) Diet duration < 7 day No viable outcome data
